intro: Tribounia venosa, commonly known as the veined tribounia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent veins and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
